qas.question: Who did the Bronx support for President in 1928?
How much of the Bronx's vote in 1916 did Hughes get?
How much of the Bronx's vote in 1916 did Wilson get?
How much of the Bronx's vote in 1916 did Benson get?
How much of the Bronx's vote in 1948 did Truman get?

context: Since then, the Bronx has always supported the Democratic Party's nominee for President, starting with a vote of 2-1 for the unsuccessful <a0_0>Al Smith<a0_0/> in 1928, followed by four 2-1 votes for the successful Franklin D. Roosevelt. (Both had been Governors of New York, but Republican former Gov. Thomas E. Dewey won only 28% of the Bronx's vote in 1948 against <a4_0>55%<a4_0/> for Pres. Harry Truman, the winning Democrat, and 17% for Henry A. Wallace of the Progressives. It was only 32 years earlier, by contrast, that another Republican former Governor who narrowly lost the Presidency, Charles Evans Hughes, had won <a1_0><a2_0>42.6%<a2_0/><a1_0/> of the Bronx's 1916 vote against Democratic President Woodrow Wilson's 49.8% and Socialist candidate Allan Benson's <a3_0>7.3%<a3_0/>.)
